fields.name: Computational Geometry
fields.description:
This course will cover early-to-mid AIME level geometry related to triangles, circles, and trigonometry. Topics include similar triangles, triangle centers, cyclic quadrilaterals, power of a point, trigonometric identities, and coordinate bashing.

This course will run on Saturdays from 3-4pm Eastern.
fields.lesson_plan:
Triangles I
Triangles II
Circles
Trigonometry
Miscellaneous
Review and Test

fields.name: Counting and Probability Principles
fields.description:
In this course, we cover common methods in counting and their applications, on early to mid AIME-level problems. Topics will include constructive and complementary counting, PIE and constructing sets, bijections (such as Stars and Bars), recursion, and path-counting.

This course will run on Saturdays from 4-5pm Eastern.
fields.lesson_plan:
Counting Basics
Sets
Bijections
Recursion
Counting Paths
Counting Test!

fields.name: My Favorite Things
fields.description:
Vieta, trig functions and prime number theories ♪ Mass points, right triangles and coordinate bashing ♩ Manipulation and geometric series ♬ These are a few of my favorite things~

In this class, we’ll be talking about a variety of tricks that are prevalent on the AMCs and early to mid AIME which I find to be particularly elegant or beautiful.

This course will run on Sundays from 4-5pm Eastern.
fields.lesson_plan:
Odds and Ends of Geometry
Best Minecraft Mods: Modular Arithmetic
It's a Sin to not Know Trig: Trigonometry
I Used Algebra to Destroy the Algebra: Algebraic Manipulations
Tree Roots and Polynomial Roots: Vieta's
Stream Sequence by IZ*ONE: Sequences and Series

fields.name: Spicy Counting
fields.description:
This course is designed to strengthen students’ counting and probability intuition skills at the early-/mid-AIME level. Students will learn a range of approaches, including constructive and complementary counting, simplification and recursion, invariants, bijections, and strategic bashing. Lectures will be heavily problem-based as AIME counting problems tend to rely on strategies and ideas rather than formulas.

This course will run on Sundays from 5-6pm Eastern.
fields.lesson_plan:
The Three C's
Judicious Adding
Level Up!
Bijections
Graph Theory
Farewell

fields.name: Algebra and Combinatorics Trail Mix
fields.description: In this course, we will go over some common techniques used on mid AMC- to early AIME-level problems. Students will become familiar with methods and tricks that cover a variety of topics, especially in combinatorics and algebra. Topics include bijections, algebraic manipulation, using inequalities, sequences and series, and recursions.
fields.lesson_plan:
Counting Clever Correspondences
Algebraic Manipulation
Inequalities
∑equences and ∑eries
Recursion and States
Look to the Future

fields.name: Counting Strategies
fields.description: This course is designed to help you enhance your combinatorics problem solving skills for early to mid AIME level problems. We will cover many different techniques, such as constructive and complementary counting, recursion, expected value, and bijections.
fields.lesson_plan:
Counting Principles
Sets
Bijections
Recursion
Other Topics
Combo Test

fields.name: Cute Geometry
fields.description: This course covers all sorts of AIME-level topics related to triangles, plus a tiny peek into olympiad geo with cyclic quadrilaterals and cool orthocenter properties. Some topics included are area, Power of a Point, and trig bashing.
fields.lesson_plan:
Similarity and Congruence
Lengths and Areas
Triangle Centers
Circle Magic
Trig
Geometry Test!

fields.name: My Favorite Things
fields.description:
Vieta, trig functions and prime number theories ♪ Mass points, right triangles and coordinate bashing ♩ Manipulation and geometric series ♬ These are a few of my favorite things~

In this class, we’ll be talking about a variety of tricks that are prevalent on the AMCs and early to mid AIME which I find to be particularly elegant or beautiful.
fields.lesson_plan:
Odds and Ends of Geometry
Best Minecraft Mods: Modular Arithmetic
It's a Sin to not Know Trig: Trigonometry
I Used Algebra to Destroy the Algebra: Algebraic Manipulations
Tree Roots and Polynomial Roots: Vieta's
Stream Sequence by IZ*ONE: Sequences and Series

fields.description: In this course, we cover common methods in counting and their applications, on early to mid AIME-level problems. Topics will include constructive and complementary counting, PIE and constructing sets, bijections (such as Stars and Bars), recursion, and path-counting.
fields.lesson_plan:
Counting Basics
Sets
Bijections
Recursion
Counting Paths
Counting Test!

fields.name: Spicy Counting
fields.description: This course is designed to strengthen students’ counting and probability intuition skills at the early-/mid-AIME level. Students will learn a range of approaches, including constructive and complementary counting, simplification and recursion, invariants, bijections, and strategic bashing. Lectures will be heavily problem-based as AIME counting problems tend to rely on strategies and ideas rather than formulas.
fields.lesson_plan:
The Three C's
Judicious Adding
Level Up!
Bijections
Graph Theory
Farewell

fields.name: Spicy Geometry
fields.description: In this course, we are going to talk about the five unique hearts of triangles and some famous theorems. Topics will include the special property of five centers and some interesting theorems, such as Ceva, Ptolemy, Monge and so on. In particular, we will solve some kinda-wonderful problems in each class!
fields.lesson_plan:
Circumcenter and incenter
Centroid, orthocenter and excenter
Menelaus and Ceva
Ptolemy and Simson
Power of a Point and Radical Axis
Review and Group Solve

fields.name: Algebra in AIME
fields.description: In this course, we will cover many algebra topics in mid-to-late AIME: trigonometry, complex numbers, polynomials, and conics. The focus of this course will be solving problems. Expect content to be covered quickly under the assumption that students are vaguely familiar with the concepts discussed.
fields.lesson_plan:
Trigonometric Identities
Complex Numbers
Polynomials I
Polynomials II
Conics
Review and Test

fields.name: Algebra and Combinatorics Trail Mix
fields.description: In this course, we will go over some common techniques used on mid AMC- to early AIME-level problems. Students will become familiar with methods and tricks that cover a variety of topics, especially in combinatorics and algebra. Topics include bijections, algebraic manipulation, using inequalities, sequences and series, and recursions.
fields.lesson_plan:
Counting Clever Correspondences
Algebraic Manipulation
Inequalities
∑equences and ∑eries
Recursion and States
Look to the Future

fields.name: Cute Geometry
fields.description: This course covers all sorts of AIME-level topics related to triangles, plus a tiny peek into olympiad geo with cyclic quadrilaterals and cool orthocenter properties. Some topics included are area, Power of a Point, and trig bashing.
fields.lesson_plan:
Similarity and Congruence
Lengths and Areas
Triangle Centers
Circle Magic
Trig
Geometry Test!

fields.description: This course is designed to help you enhance your combinatorics problem solving skills for early to mid AIME level problems. We will cover many different techniques, such as constructive and complementary counting, recursion, expected value, and bijections.
fields.lesson_plan:
Counting Principles
Sets
Bijections
Recursion
Other Topics
Combo Test

fields.name: NT Olympiad Fundamentals
fields.description: In this course, we cover many of the fundamental concepts in late-AIME and Olympiad number theory, such as divisibility, size bounding, modular arithmetic, polynomials, and orders. By taking this course, you'll gain a solid foundation on number theory at a high level.
fields.lesson_plan:
Divisibility
Modular Arithmetic
Exponents and Orders
Polynomials
Miscellaneous
Review and Test

fields.name: Algebra and NT Fundamentals
fields.description: This course will provide an introduction to early-AIME algebra and number theory. Students will learn how to tackle problems using techniques like Vieta's formulas, roots of unity, modular arithmetic, logarithm properties, and more.
fields.lesson_plan:
Polynomials
Divisibility and Bases
Complex Numbers
Modular Arithmetic
Harder Equations and Inequalities
Review and Test

fields.name: Spicy Geometry
fields.description: In this course, we are going to talk about the five unique hearts of triangles and some famous theorems. Topics will include the special property of five centers and some interesting theorems, such as Ceva, Ptolemy, Monge and so on. In particular, we will solve some kinda-wonderful problems in each class!

Circumcenter and Incenter
Centroid, Orthocenter and Excenter
Menelaus and Ceva
Ptolemy and Simson
Power of a Point and Radical Axis
Review and Group Solve

fields.name: Cute Geometry
fields.description: This course covers all sorts of AIME-level topics related to triangles, plus a tiny peek into olympiad geo with cyclic quadrilaterals and cool orthocenter properties. Some topics included are area, Power of a Point, and trig bashing.
fields.lesson_plan:
Similarity and Congruence
Lengths and Areas
Triangle Centers
Circle Magic
Trig
Geometry Test!

fields.name: Counting Strategies
fields.description: This course is designed to help you enhance your combinatorics problem solving skills for early to mid AIME level problems. We will cover many different techniques, such as constructive and complementary counting, recursion, expected value, and bijections.
fields.lesson_plan:
Counting Principles
Sets
Bijections
Recursion
Other Topics
Combo Test

fields.name: Adorable Algebra
fields.description: This course will cover many of the fundamental Algebra techniques you will need to know for the AMC 12 and the AIME, such as Exponents and Logarithms, Piecewise Functions, Rates, Trigonometry and Complex Numbers, Polynomials and Symmetric equations, and Inequalities. Taking this course will help solidify your understanding of these topics and feel comfortable applying them.
fields.lesson_plan:
Rates
Polynomials and Symmetric Expressions
Trigonometry and Complex Numbers
Exponents and Logarithms
Piecewise Functions
Inequalities

fields.name: Combinections
fields.description: In this course, we cover all the fundamental concepts and techniques used in combinatorics at the AMC/AIME level, including recursion, probability states, expected value, generating functions, and much more. This course aims to help you develop your intuition and build your toolkit so you can tackle any combo problem you face!
fields.lesson_plan:
Constructive Counting
One to One Correspondences
Induction and Recursion
Combinatorial Arguments
Interesting Cases
General Tips + Test

fields.name: j'AIME the AMC: Algebra Meets Combinatorics
fields.description: In this course, you will learn important concepts in AMC to early-AIME level algebra and combinatorics. Through seeing examples and doing problem sets, you’ll be able to apply concepts such as complementary counting, recurrences, and complex numbers. This course will help you recognize when certain strategies in algebra and combinatorics may be helpful on problems and how to solve them.
fields.lesson_plan:
Counting Techniques
Probability
Recurrences and Bijections
Equations and Polynomials
Complex Numbers
Sequences and Logarithms

fields.name: Comical Combo
fields.description: This course will cover the combinatorial techniques and general strategies used in AIME-level problems. Topics include how to deal with restrictions, casework, bijections, recursion, and Principle of Inclusion-Exclusion.
fields.lesson_plan:
Basics
Restrictions
Casework
Perspectives
Frogs and Recursion
Principle of Inclusion and Exclusion

fields.name: Get to Know Number Theory
fields.description: In this course, you will learn about an introduction in number theory and some of stuffs that very useful for problems. We also cover many of important concepts and some of strategies.
fields.lesson_plan:
Basic stuff for the beginners
Prime numbers
Useful things for solving NT problems
Famous theorems
Order and Primitive roots
Review

fields.name: AIME Geo
fields.description: This course will cover the fundamentals of AIME-level geometry problems. We will cover some useful theorems and problem-solving strategies. We will also cover some basic olympiad geometry.
fields.lesson_plan:
Similarity
Circles
Trigonometry
Length Chasing
Triangle Centers
Construction

fields.name: Art of Trigonometry (ft. Problem Solving)
fields.description: Art of Trigonometry (ft. Problem Solving) is a mid AIME to beginning olympiad level class focused on how to use trigonometry as a tool to simply solve high difficulty problems. The class will cover applications of trigonometry in both algebra and geometry.
fields.lesson_plan:
Trig Definitions and Basics
Trig Formulas (Law of Sine, Law of Cosine, Ratio Lemma, Trig Ceva's, etc.)
Simplifying Geo Diagrams with Trig
Trigonometric Equations
Applications in the Complex Plane
Is Using Trig Always A Good Idea?

fields.name: NT Olympiad Fundamentals
fields.description: In this course, we cover many of the fundamental concepts in late-AIME and Olympiad number theory, such as divisibility, size bounding, modular arithmetic, polynomials, and orders. By taking this course, you'll gain a solid foundation on number theory at a high level.
fields.lesson_plan:
Divisibility
Modular Arithmetic
Exponents and Orders
Polynomials
Miscellaneous
Review and Test

fields.name: AIME Combo
fields.description: In this course we cover some of the fundamental concepts of olympiad combinatorics, such as permutations, probability, catalan numbers, and dismutations as well as different principles like pigeonhole and inclusion-exclusion. By taking this course you will learn how to approach and set up computational olympiad problems.
fields.lesson_plan:
Everything with Anagrams
Sets and the Principle of Inclusion-Exclusion
Probability Fundamentals
Derangements and Catalan Numbers
Pigeonhole Principle
Setting Up Problems

fields.name: Outstanding Olympiad Geometry
fields.description: This course will cover many fundamental theorems and concepts in Olympiad geometry. Some topics we will discuss include the Euler Line, the Nine-Point Circle, the Incenter/Excenter Lemma, Power of a Point, Ceva’s Theorem, the Simson Line, and many other cool configurations!
fields.lesson_plan:
Triangles I
Triangles II
Circles
Length and Area Ratios
Cool Configurations
Group Solve

fields.name: Quirky Geometry
fields.description: In this class, we will be exploring several heuristics and philosophies that are useful in tackling Olympiad Geometry of any level (with occasional computational exercises). The lectures are designed not to be theory-heavy (so you will not be learning scary lemmas and theorems): instead, the goal is to discover ideas through problem-solving. A solid grasp of chapters 1-3 of EGMO is recommended to attend this course.
fields.lesson_plan:
Midpoints and Parallelograms
Construct
Triangle Centers
Power of a Point
Eraser
Quick!

fields.name: Adorable Algebra
fields.description: This course will cover many of the fundamental Algebra techniques you will need to know for the AMC 12 and the AIME, such as Exponents and Logarithms, Piecewise Functions, Rates, Trigonometry and Complex Numbers, Polynomials and Symmetric equations, and Inequalities. Taking this course will help solidify your understanding of these topics and feel comfortable applying them.
fields.lesson_plan:
Rates
Polynomials and Symmetric Expressions
Trigonometry and Complex Numbers
Exponents and Logarithms
Piecewise Functions
Inequalities

fields.name: Combinections
fields.description: In this course, we cover all the fundamental concepts and techniques used in combinatorics at the AMC/AIME level, including recursion, probability states, expected value, generating functions, and much more. This course aims to help you develop your intuition and build your toolkit so you can tackle any combo problem you face!

General Tips + Test

fields.name: Get to Know Number Theory
fields.description: In this course, you will learn about an introduction in number theory and some of stuffs that very useful for problems. We also cover many of important concepts and some of strategies.
fields.lesson_plan:
Basic stuff for the beginners
Prime numbers and Congruence
Famous theorems
p-adic valuation
Diophantine equations
Reviewing

fields.name: AIME Geo
fields.description: This course will cover the fundamentals of AIME-level geometry problems. We will cover some useful theorems and problem-solving strategies. We will also cover some basic olympiad geometry.
fields.lesson_plan:
Similarity
Circles
Trigonometry
Length Chasing
Triangle Centers
Construction

fields.name: Art of Trigonometry (ft. Problem Solving)
fields.description: Art of Trigonometry (ft. Problem Solving) is a mid AIME to beginning olympiad level class focused on how to use trigonometry as a tool to simply solve high difficulty problems. The class will cover applications of trigonometry in both algebra and geometry.
fields.lesson_plan:
Trig Definitions and Basics
Trig Formulas (Law of Sine, Law of Cosine, Ratio Lemma, Trig Ceva's, etc.)
Simplifying Geo Diagrams with Trig
Trigonometric Equations
Applications in the Complex Plane
Is Using Trig Always A Good Idea?

fields.name: NT Olympiad Fundamentals
fields.description: In this course, we cover many of the fundamental concepts in late-AIME and Olympiad number theory, such as divisibility, size bounding, modular arithmetic, polynomials, and orders. By taking this course, you'll gain a solid foundation on number theory at a high level.
fields.lesson_plan:
Divisibility
Modular Arithmetic
Exponents and Orders
Polynomials
Miscellaneous
Review and Test

By taking this course you will learn how to approach and set up computational olympiad problems.

fields.description: This course will cover many fundamental theorems and concepts in Olympiad geometry. Some topics we will discuss include the Euler Line, the Nine-Point Circle, the Incenter/Excenter Lemma, Power of a Point, Ceva’s Theorem, the Simson Line, and many other cool configurations!
fields.lesson_plan:
Triangles I
Triangles II
Circles

Cool Configurations
Group Solve

fields.name: Quirky Geometry
fields.description: In this class, we will be exploring several heuristics and philosophies that are useful in tackling Olympiad Geometry of any level (with occasional computational exercises). The lectures are designed not to be theory-heavy (so you will not be learning scary lemmas and theorems): instead, the goal is to discover ideas through problem-solving. A solid grasp of chapters 1-3 of EGMO is recommended to attend this course.
fields.lesson_plan:
Midpoints and Parallelograms
Construct
Triangle Centers
Power of a Point
Eraser
Quick!

fields.name: Nifty NT and Algebra
fields.description: In this class, we will be learning important ideas of algebra and number theory that often appear on the AMC or AIME, such as the Division Theorem, Vieta's formulas, modular arithmetic, the Euclidean Algorithm, and the Chinese Remainder Theorem. In addition, we will be exploring some fun topics like weird divisibility rules and finite differences!
fields.lesson_plan:
Algebraic Identities and Manipulation
Polynomials
Modular Arithmetic I
Modular Arithmetic II
Bases and Divisibility
Finite Differences

fields.name: Cute Geometry
fields.description: This course covers lots of AMC-AIME level topics related to triangles, cyclic quadrilaterals, area, power of a point, and trig, plus a tiny peek into higher topics such as special centers of a triangle.
fields.lesson_plan:
Similarity and Congruence
Lengths and Areas
Circle Magic
Trig
Triangle Centers I
Triangle Centers II

fields.name: ComboneNT
fields.description: ComboneNT is a course focusing on Combo-flavoured Number Theory – that is, how characteristics of the integers, such as divisibility, can translate into useful combinatorial properties. It presents insights and techniques from both the Combo and NT perspectives, exploring how such ideas have surfaced in recent years, and offering strategies for AMC, AIME, and introductory Olympiad problems.
fields.lesson_plan:
Prime Number Properties, GCD and LCM, Divisibility
Modular Arithmetic
Counting Techniques
Introduction to Olympiad Topics I
Introduction to Olympiad Topics II
Test and Recap

fields.name: NT Terrain Navigation
fields.description: In this course, we will be “navigating terrain” in number theory, exploring different ideas and useful techniques for computational number theory problems. Along with learning some famous fundamental theorems and other important topics, you will also gain more intuition on how to approach tricky problems.
fields.lesson_plan:
Mod Fundamentals
Bases and Digits
Famous Theorems
Factors and Divisibility
Prime Powers and Factorials
Intuition and Vibes

fields.name: Comical Combo
fields.description: This course will cover the combinatorial techniques and general strategies used in AIME-level problems. Topics include how to deal with restrictions, casework, bijections, recursion, and Principle of Inclusion-Exclusion.
fields.lesson_plan:
Basics
Restrictions
Casework
Perspectives
Frogs and Recursion
Principle of Inclusion and Exclusion

fields.name: Affable Algebraic Affairs
fields.description: This course covers common algebra topics that appear time and time again on the AMCs and AIMEs, such as polynomials, sequences and series, and trigonometry. We’ll cover the basics, then look at some more complex applications, including some clever manipulations and techniques.
fields.lesson_plan:
Factoring and Identities
Polynomials and Manipulations
Series and Weird Functions
Trig Formulas and Substitutions
Complex Numbers
Inequalities

fields.name: Classy Adventures in Combinatorics and Algebra
fields.description: In this class, we will cover many of my favorite topics in combinatorics and algebra which commonly appear on the AIME. Some topics we will cover include bijections, combinatorial perspectives, recursion, handling polynomials, and complex numbers. We will see how these topics show up in various ways and you will become more comfortable applying them, and also improve your general problem solving skills.
fields.lesson_plan:
Polynomials
Bijections and Combinatorial Identities
Recursion and States
Trigonometry
Complex Numbers
Combinatorial Arguments

fields.name: Art of Trigonometry (ft. Problem Solving)
fields.description: Art of Trigonometry (ft. Problem Solving) is a mid AIME to beginning olympiad level class focused on how to use trigonometry as a tool to simply solve high difficulty problems. The class will cover applications of trigonometry in both algebra and geometry.
fields.lesson_plan:
Trig Definitions and Basics
Trig Formulas (Law of Sine, Law of Cosine, Ratio Lemma, Trig Ceva's, etc.)
Simplifying Geo Diagrams with Trig
Trigonometric Equations
Applications in the Complex Plane
Is Using Trig Always A Good Idea?

fields.name: AIME Combo
fields.description: In this course we cover some of the fundamental concepts of olympiad combinatorics, such as permutations, probability, catalan numbers, and dismutations as well as different principles like pigeonhole and inclusion-exclusion. By taking this course you will learn how to approach and set up computational olympiad problems.
fields.lesson_plan:
Everything with Anagrams
Sets and the Principle of Inclusion-Exclusion
Probability Fundamentals
Derangements and Catalan Numbers
Pigeonhole Principle
Setting Up Problems

fields.name: Get to Know Number Theory
fields.description: In this course, you will learn about an introduction in number theory and some of stuffs that very useful for problems. We also cover many of important concepts and some of strategies.
fields.lesson_plan:
Basic Things (Divisibility, GCD, LCM, Bezout, Division Algorithm)
Prime numbers and Congruence
Famous Theorems (Fermat Little Theorem, Euler, Wilson, Chinese Remainder)
Lifting the Exponent
Fusion Problems equations
Talk About Nontheory Things / Small Quiz

fields.name: Outstanding Olympiad Geometry
fields.description: This course will cover many fundamental theorems and concepts in Olympiad geometry. Some topics we will discuss include the Euler Line, the Nine-Point Circle, the Incenter/Excenter Lemma, Power of a Point, Ceva’s Theorem, the Simson Line, and many other cool configurations!
fields.lesson_plan:
Triangles I
Triangles II
Circles
Length and Area Ratios
Cool Configurations
Group Solve

fields.name: Combo Heuristics
fields.description: This course will cover various thinking processes and strategies used to solve olympiad problems (with some computational applications as well!). Rather than focusing on techniques, the topics emphasize intuitive reasoning and gaining a deep understanding of the subject. This class is suitable for anyone with a solid combinatorial background looking to try some cool problems!
fields.lesson_plan:
Underlying Structure
Processes
Constructions
Intro to Graph Theory
Forcing Moves
Some Fun Challenges!

fields.name: Fun + Heights
fields.description: Fun + Heights is a beginning to middle olympiad level class focusing on fun(ctional equations) and diophantine equation-based number theory. This class will cover fundamentals in functional equations and the uses of prime divisors in number theory.
fields.lesson_plan:
Cauchy's Functional Equation
FEs, Part 2
Manipulations and Lagrange Interpolation
Introduction to Diophantine Equations
Diophantines, Part 1 - Orders
Diophantines, Part 2 - Lifting the Exponent

fields.name: Quirky Geometry
fields.description: In this class, we will be exploring several heuristics and philosophies that are useful in tackling Olympiad Geometry of any level (with occasional computational exercises). The lectures are designed not to be theory-heavy (so you will not be learning scary lemmas and theorems): instead, the goal is to discover ideas through problem-solving. A solid grasp of chapters 1-3 of EGMO is recommended to attend this course.
fields.lesson_plan:
Midpoints and Parallelograms
Construct
Triangle Centers
Power of a Point
Eraser
Quick!

fields.name: Nifty NT and Algebra
fields.description: In this class, we will be learning important ideas of algebra and number theory that often appear on the AMC or AIME, such as the Division Theorem, Vieta's formulas, modular arithmetic, the Euclidean Algorithm, and the Chinese Remainder Theorem. In addition, we will be exploring some fun topics like weird divisibility rules and finite differences!
fields.lesson_plan:
Algebraic Identities and Manipulation
Polynomials
Modular Arithmetic I
Modular Arithmetic II
Bases and Divisibility
Finite Differences

fields.name: ComboneNT
fields.description: ComboneNT is a course focusing on Combo-flavoured Number Theory – that is, how characteristics of the integers, such as divisibility, can translate into useful combinatorial properties. It presents insights and techniques from both the Combo and NT perspectives, exploring how such ideas have surfaced in recent years, and offering strategies for AMC, AIME, and introductory Olympiad problems.
fields.lesson_plan:
Prime Number Properties, GCD and LCM, Divisibility
Modular Arithmetic
Counting Techniques
Introduction to Olympiad Topics I
Introduction to Olympiad Topics II
Test and Recap

fields.name: Cute Geometry
fields.description: This course covers lots of AMC-AIME level topics related to triangles, cyclic quadrilaterals, area, power of a point, and trig, plus a tiny peek into higher topics such as special centers of a triangle.
fields.lesson_plan:
Similarity and Congruence
Lengths and Areas
Circle Magic
Trig
Triangle Centers I
Triangle Centers II

fields.name: NT Terrain Navigation
fields.description: In this course, we will be “navigating terrain” in number theory, exploring different ideas and useful techniques for computational number theory problems. Along with learning some famous fundamental theorems and other important topics, you will also gain more intuition on how to approach tricky problems.
fields.lesson_plan:
Mod Fundamentals
Bases and Digits
Famous Theorems
Factors and Divisibility
Prime Powers and Factorials
Intuition and Vibes

fields.name: Comical Combo
fields.description: This course will cover the combinatorial techniques and general strategies used in AIME-level problems. Topics include how to deal with restrictions, casework, bijections, recursion, and Principle of Inclusion-Exclusion.
fields.lesson_plan:
Basics
Restrictions
Casework
Perspectives
Frogs and Recursion
Principle of Inclusion and Exclusion

fields.name: Affable Algebraic Affairs
fields.description: This course covers common algebra topics that appear time and time again on the AMCs and AIMEs, such as polynomials, sequences and series, and trigonometry. We’ll cover the basics, then look at some more complex applications, including some clever manipulations and techniques.
fields.lesson_plan:
Factoring and Identities
Polynomials and Manipulations
Series and Weird Functions
Trig Formulas and Substitutions
Complex Numbers
Inequalities

fields.name: Classy Adventures in Combinatorics and Algebra
fields.description: In this class, we will cover many of my favorite topics in combinatorics and algebra which commonly appear on the AIME. Some topics we will cover include bijections, combinatorial perspectives, recursion, handling polynomials, and complex numbers. We will see how these topics show up in various ways and you will become more comfortable applying them, and also improve your general problem solving skills.
fields.lesson_plan:
Polynomials
Bijections and Combinatorial Identities
Recursion and States
Trigonometry
Complex Numbers
Combinatorial Arguments

fields.name: Art of Trigonometry (ft. Problem Solving)
fields.description: Art of Trigonometry (ft. Problem Solving) is a mid AIME to beginning olympiad level class focused on how to use trigonometry as a tool to simply solve high difficulty problems. The class will cover applications of trigonometry in both algebra and geometry.
fields.lesson_plan:
Trig Definitions and Basics
Trig Formulas (Law of Sine, Law of Cosine, Ratio Lemma, Trig Ceva's, etc.)
Simplifying Geo Diagrams with Trig
Trigonometric Equations
Applications in the Complex Plane
Is Using Trig Always A Good Idea?

fields.name: AIME Combo
fields.description: In this course we cover some of the fundamental concepts of olympiad combinatorics, such as permutations, probability, catalan numbers, and dismutations as well as different principles like pigeonhole and inclusion-exclusion. By taking this course you will learn how to approach and set up computational olympiad problems.
fields.lesson_plan:
Everything with Anagrams
Sets and the Principle of Inclusion-Exclusion
Probability Fundamentals
Derangements and Catalan Numbers
Pigeonhole Principle
Setting Up Problems

fields.name: Get to Know Number Theory
fields.description: In this course, you will learn about an introduction in number theory and some of stuffs that very useful for problems. We also cover many of important concepts and some of strategies.
fields.lesson_plan:
Basic Things (Divisibility, GCD, LCM, Bezout, Division Algorithm)
Prime numbers and Congruence
Famous Theorems (Fermat Little Theorem, Euler, Wilson, Chinese Remainder)
Lifting the Exponent
Fusion Problems equations
Talk About Nontheory Things / Small Quiz

fields.name: Outstanding Olympiad Geometry
fields.description: This course will cover many fundamental theorems and concepts in Olympiad geometry. Some topics we will discuss include the Euler Line, the Nine-Point Circle, the Incenter/Excenter Lemma, Power of a Point, Ceva’s Theorem, the Simson Line, and many other cool configurations!
fields.lesson_plan:
Triangles I
Triangles II
Circles
Length and Area Ratios
Cool Configurations
Group Solve

fields.name: Combo Heuristics
fields.description: This course will cover various thinking processes and strategies used to solve olympiad problems (with some computational applications as well!). Rather than focusing on techniques, the topics emphasize intuitive reasoning and gaining a deep understanding of the subject. This class is suitable for anyone with a solid combinatorial background looking to try some cool problems!
fields.lesson_plan:
Underlying Structure
Processes
Constructions
Intro to Graph Theory
Forcing Moves
Some Fun Challenges!

fields.name: Fun + Heights
fields.description: Fun + Heights is a beginning to middle olympiad level class focusing on fun(ctional equations) and diophantine equation-based number theory. This class will cover fundamentals in functional equations and the uses of prime divisors in number theory.
fields.lesson_plan:
Cauchy's Functional Equation
FEs, Part 2
Manipulations and Lagrange Interpolation
Introduction to Diophantine Equations
Diophantines, Part 1 - Orders
Diophantines, Part 2 - Lifting the Exponent

fields.description: In this class, we will be exploring several heuristics and philosophies that are useful in tackling Olympiad Geometry of any level (with occasional computational exercises). The lectures are designed not to be theory-heavy (so you will not be learning scary lemmas and theorems): instead, the goal is to discover ideas through problem-solving. A solid grasp of chapters 1-3 of EGMO is recommended to attend this course.
fields.lesson_plan:
Midpoints and Parallelograms
Construct
Triangle Centers
Power of a Point
Eraser
Quick!

fields.name: Cute Geometry
fields.description: In this course, we will be exploring different geometry ideas often seen on the AMC and AIME, such as Stewart’s Theorem, Power of a Point, Law of Cosine, Law of Sine, and useful properties of different triangle centers.
fields.lesson_plan:
Similarity and Congruence
Lengths and Areas
Circle Magic
Trigonometry
Triangle Centers 1
Triangle Centers 2

fields.name: Cozy Combo
fields.description: This course will cover many combinatorics topics seen on the AMC and AIME, such as permutations, probability. Principle of Inclusion-Exclusion, and different bijections.
fields.lesson_plan:
Counting/Permutations
Casework
Probability Basics
PIE + Pigeonhole Principle
Bijections
TBD, something fun!

fields.name: Nifty NT and Algebra
fields.description: In this class, we will be learning important ideas of algebra and number theory that often appear on the AMC or AIME, such as the Division Theorem, Vieta's formulas, modular arithmetic, the Euclidean Algorithm, and the Chinese Remainder Theorem. In addition, we will be exploring some fun topics like weird divisibility rules and finite differences!

Polynomials
Modular Arithmetic I
Modular Arithmetic II
Bases and Divisibility
Finite Differences
